meanings.definition: The action of moving or being moved apart.
meanings.sent1: The separation of the two friends made them sad.
meanings.sent2: The separation of the clouds allowed the sun to shine through.
meanings.sent3: The separation of the puzzle pieces was necessary to solve it.
meanings.sent4: The separation of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The separation of the dancers on stage created a beautiful performance.

meanings.definition: The state in which two or more things are not touching or connected.
meanings.sent1: The separation between the two buildings was filled with flowers.
meanings.sent2: The separation of the magnets prevented them from attracting each other.
meanings.sent3: The separation of the books on the shelf made them easier to find.
meanings.sent4: The separation of the stars in the sky was like a twinkling blanket.
meanings.sent5: The separation of the ingredients in the recipe was crucial for the dish to turn out well.

meanings.definition: The process of dividing or disconnecting something into parts.
meanings.sent1: The separation of the cake into slices made it easier to share.
meanings.sent2: The separation of the wires required careful handling to avoid damage.
meanings.sent3: The separation of the colors in the painting added depth to the artwork.
meanings.sent4: The separation of the music into different tracks allowed for individual adjustments.
meanings.sent5: The separation of the cells in the experiment was done under a microscope.
